channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report X-2025011010
item.description:
Report X-2025011010

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon notification from Mr. Kyzer, I advised him to isolate tracks on either side of this car until the car could be assessed. Code 3 was contacted and mobilized a crew. I was enroute as well. Upon arrival it was determined that the car was dripping from the bottom outlet stem packing gland due to the packing retainer nuts being several turns loose. The nuts were equally tightened until the leak stopped. The car was observed for several minutes, and no drips or leaks were observed. The bottom outlet was wiped dry, and the car was placed in HZ hold until an OTMA could be obtained by the shipper. Less than 1/2 gallon released and evaporated.
